newsitem.title: UK: UK new car registations up 12.3 pct in yr to April.
newsitem.headline: UK new car registations up 12.3 pct in yr to April.

text.p: New car registrations rose by 12.3 percent in the year to April, the Society of Motor Manufacturers and Traders (SMMT) said in Wednesday.
The total of new cars registered in the month was 182,747 compared with 162,618 in April 1996. Imports took 64.2 percent of market share in the month compared with 61.3 percent in April 1996.

Registrations for the first four months of the year totalled 732,281, 5.5 percent increase over April 1996. "These figures are most encouraging," said Ernie Thompson, SMMT chief executive. "Traditional seasonal upturn combined with intense marketing effort by manufacturers and retailers are pulling more private customers into showrooms."
He said he hoped the trend would continue despite the rise in interest rates on Tuesday. -- Rosemary Bennett +44 171 542 7715
